metadata.Title: CVE-2021-39537 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in ncurses through v6.2-1. _nc_captoinfo in captoinfo.c has a heap-based buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses6 - 6.3-2
lib32ncursesw6 - 6.3-2
lib32tinfo6 - 6.3-2
lib64ncurses6 - 6.3-2
lib64ncursesw6 - 6.3-2
lib64tinfo6 - 6.3-2
libncurses5 - 6.3-2
libncurses6 - 6.3-2
libncursesw5 - 6.3-2
libncursesw6 - 6.3-2
libtinfo5 - 6.3-2
libtinfo6 - 6.3-2
ncurses-base - 6.3-2
ncurses-bin - 6.3-2
ncurses-examples - 6.3-2
ncurses-term - 6.3-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> read of size 1, DoS only

criterions.comment: ncurses package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3-2').
